summary: Mary Susan Grimes was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). She is listed in payroll and certification reports from April 1978, August 1978, and December 1978. These documents detail her employment, annual salary, and gross pay during those periods. The documents do not specify her exact role within the SCAS, but her presence on the payroll indicates she was a staff member.
significance: Mary Susan Grimes' significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating her involvement in the investigation, though her specific role and contribution are not detailed in these documents.
